feedback:
Good application of DRIVER framework (demonstrated 4 stages). Consider strengthening the stages you didn't explicitly show.


STRENGTHS:
- Financial APP: The submission provides concrete financial examples (line-item variances) and shows the tool taking input, running code, and producing a finance-focused output, demonstrating it functions as a financial application. DISCOVER establishes the domain need and IMPLEMENT shows the tool operates end-to-end.
- Integrate AI: The student shows a concrete AI-enabled tool that converts raw variance data into narrative explanations and demonstrates the generate workflow and code linkage, indicating integration adds real value. Given the conceptual demo, example inputs/outputs, and implementation evidence, this meets PASS under the moderate evaluation standard.

criteria.criterion_name: Financial APP: The tool functions as a financial application.
evidence: "my project is the Variance Explainer. It solves key problems for corporate finance teams, um efficiently translating complex budget to actual variance and reports into a clear business-focused narrative for non-finance leaders."
"I will paste um some sample variances data. And so, the software expense is the 50,000 over budget due to the new HR platform and the travel 15,000 under budget due to the shift to video."
"and then you hit generate, which is this part of the code right here, um, and the output appears. As you can see, the AI transforms the raw data into a structured narrative."
criteria.driver_alignment:
DISCOVER — student identifies a clear FP&A problem, target users, and specific financial use case (budget vs actual variance). 
IMPLEMENT — student demonstrates an input, the generate action in code, and a produced output, indicating a working financial application.
criteria.reasoning: The submission provides concrete financial examples (line-item variances) and shows the tool taking input, running code, and producing a finance-focused output, demonstrating it functions as a financial application. DISCOVER establishes the domain need and IMPLEMENT shows the tool operates end-to-end.

criteria.criterion_name: Integrate AI: The tool integrates AI capabilities effectively.
evidence: "my project is the Variance Explainer. It solves key problems for corporate finance teams, um efficiently translating complex budget to actual variance and reports into a clear business-focused narrative for non-finance leaders."
"I built a tool to automate that translation instantly, which is here."
"and then you hit generate, which is this part of the code right here, um, and the output appears. As you can see, the AI transforms the raw data into a structured narrative."
criteria.driver_alignment: DISCOVER — articulated a clear user problem and value proposition for automating variance explanations; IMPLEMENT — demonstrated a UI flow ("generate" button), code reference, and showed AI-produced output.
criteria.reasoning: The student shows a concrete AI-enabled tool that converts raw variance data into narrative explanations and demonstrates the generate workflow and code linkage, indicating integration adds real value. Given the conceptual demo, example inputs/outputs, and implementation evidence, this meets PASS under the moderate evaluation standard.
